channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CASSANDRA-11176] SSTableRewriter.InvalidateKeys should have a weak reference to cache
item.description:
From aweisberg

The SSTableReader.DropPageCache runnable references SSTableRewriter.InvalidateKeys which references the cache. The cache reference should be a WeakReference.

ERROR [Strong-Reference-Leak-Detector:1] 2016-02-17 14:51:52,111  NoSpamLogger.java:97 - Strong self-ref loop detected [/var/lib/cassandra/data/keyspace1/standard1-990bc741d56411e591d5590d7a7ad312/ma-20-big,

item.summary: SSTableRewriter.InvalidateKeys should have a weak reference to cache

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: uh start with -Dcassandra.debugrefcount=true, run stress and wait it seems

Patches here;

branch testall dtest
marcuse/11176-2.1 testall dtest
marcuse/11176-2.2 testall dtest
marcuse/11176-3.0 testall dtest
marcuse/11176-trunk testall dtest

for dtests I think we should simply run all tests with -Dcassandra.debugrefcount=true :
https://github.com/krummas/cassandra-dtest/commits/marcuse/debugrefcount
https://github.com/krummas/ccm/commits/marcuse/default_jvm_args

Test run using the ccm/dtest branches above against standard 3.0:
http://cassci.datastax.com/view/Dev/view/krummas/job/krummas-marcuse-3.0-dtest/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/ (we get the error message in one test atleast)
and using the branch against patched 3.0:
http://cassci.datastax.com/view/Dev/view/krummas/job/krummas-marcuse-11176-dtest/

I looked at the changes and it looks good. Debugging the ref count by default is a good idea, but it won't run until 15 minutes have passed. Seems like it doesn't do much in most scenarios. I would kind of expect to have it running all the time on one core and assume that tests have to perform acceptably in that scenario.

When I tried to check the tests in cassci it looks like they didn't run?

When I tried to check the tests in cassci it looks like they didn't run?

uh, must have forgotten starting the tests, did that now

I would kind of expect to have it running all the time on one core and assume that tests have to perform acceptably in that scenario.

I just checked and during dtests both checks seem to run in <20ms, so we could probably just change the rate (run every second maybe?)
Sure once a second seems reasonable. Should kick in for a lot of dtests that way.

I made the change to check every second and it seems it makes a bunch of tests unrelated to this ticket fail - http://cassci.datastax.com/job/krummas-marcuse-11176-trunk-dtest/2/

If it is OK with you, I will revert the rate-change and create a new ticket to do the change handle the failing tests?

OK. Looks like it found another reference loop. The tidy can get to the tracker through LogTransaction$SSTableTidier which references the tracker. Still trying to figure out how to break that up.

ERROR [Strong-Reference-Leak-Detector:1] 2016-03-01 07:18:05,811 NoSpamLogger.java:97 - Strong self-ref loop detected [/mnt/tmp/dtest-cjmaDm/test/node1/data2/system/local-7ad54392bcdd35a684174e047860b377/ma-10-big, private volatile java.lang.Runnable Also I think those tests are failing because enabling the loop detection caused it to detect loops and the test harness is seeing the errors and complaining.

If you want to break that out into a separate ticket that is fine.
Thanks, committed and created CASSANDRA-11296 for the dtest refcount checking
What about the leak that's already been detected? It's not in the new ticket and it's kind of orthogonal.
aweisberg what do you mean? I posted the test result with that leak in the first comment?
My mistake. I thought the ticket was scoped to the test change.
